*Document Management Systems* (DMS) is the use of a computer system and software to store, manage and track electronic documents and electronic images of paper-based information captured through the use of a document scanner. The term document is defined as "recorded information or an object which can be treated as a unit".
Document Management Systems allows documents to be modified and managed but typically lack the records retention and disposition functionality for managing records.
